intro: Artemisia bigelowii, commonly known as Bigelow's sagebrush, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and aromatic, often fuzzy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Artemisia bigelowii plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
